paragraphs.text: Wasn’t suggesting there was data to be sold or that you would sell it, but a box for sign up is still an opportunity to sell— whether it’s free content or not?
paragraphs.name: 260d

cfd2cc98132.title: This is actually the first article I’m thoroughly reading before other UX articles today, thanks…

paragraphs.text: This is actually the first article I’m thoroughly reading before other UX articles today, thanks for the heads up!
paragraphs.name: 390a

2c050b157381.title: Here’s the real issue with the whole idea of UX content marketing: it limits us.

paragraphs.text: Here’s the real issue with the whole idea of UX content marketing: it limits us. There is no incentive for a company to publish articles with topics outside of the realm of what might lead back to a sale. For UXers trying to bolster their personal brand, there is no incentive to write about ideas that wouldn’t sound impressive to a general audience…
paragraphs.name: 8cea

paragraphs.text: Love it!
paragraphs.name: b5a5

paragraphs.text: Yep, very unfortunate. I think less people realize they’re being sold to than we would hope. But it’s also up to us to try to change that. Thanks for your visit.

paragraphs.text: Controversial topic eh? I think you have some valid points but at the end of the day the beauty of the internet is free access to information — shouldn’t we just let people judge for themselves what’s best?

paragraphs.text: I do love that the UX community is all about sharing and I wouldn’t like to change. I agree, sometimes it’s harder to…

3ecbf880a29.title: What you write is, to an extent, very true.

paragraphs.text: What you write is, to an extent, very true.

paragraphs.text: For better or worse, many of the “clickbait” headlines around (and there are a lot of them) are, sadly, the new normal for gaining attention for even the best-intentioned pieces.

cf4eceff548f.title: This is a great article and important subject.

paragraphs.text: This is a great article and important subject. I think there is nothing wrong with content marketing and promoting yourself. But it becomes a problem when people publish stuff without anything new or interesting to say, just to attract some traffic, rehashing the same content over and over, and packing in as many keywords as they can. There is a real…
paragraphs.name: 21ae

paragraphs.text: Thanks for the honest state of affairs Fabrico. It’s something I’m becoming ever increasingly aware of and it’s good that you’ve described the lay of the land for us readers. Let’s hope more content publishers start to follow your lead.
paragraphs.name: 4c6a

paragraphs.text: Absolutely. Like we state in the article, we are also part of the “sell their personal brand” group. Even if we don’t sell data or ad space in our platform, we certainly benefit from the visibility that it gives us. There’s always a sell – it’s just a matter of, as a reader, paying attention to what the writer’s interests really are. May sound…

ddee667a961c.title: If the value is there — does it really matter if you are being sold to?

paragraphs.text: If the value is there — does it really matter if you are being sold to? It’s your decision weather you enquire further about that companies products/services or weather you close that tab.
paragraphs.name: fd74

paragraphs.text: Granted some companies ‘shove it down your throat’ for lack of a better phrase, but that’s the exception not the rule.
